skill.name: matlab
skill.description: MATLAB and GNU Octave numerical computing for matrix operations, data analysis, visualization, and scientific computing. Use when writing MATLAB/Octave scripts for linear algebra, signal processing, image processing, differential equations, optimization, statistics, or creating scientific visualizations. Also use when the user needs help with MATLAB syntax, functions, or wants to convert between MATLAB and Python code. Scripts can be executed with MATLAB or the open-source GNU Octave interpreter.
skill.summary: MATLAB and GNU Octave numerical computing for matrix operations, data analysis, visualization, and s...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI
skill.license: For MATLAB (https://www.mathworks.com/pricing-licensing.html) and for Octave (GNU General Public License version 3)

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation skill containing MATLAB/Octave programming reference materials. All 645 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting MATLAB code examples in markdown files. The 'backtick execution' detections are markdown code fences, the 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags are documentation of hash functions (md5, sha1) in MATLAB, and the 'sudo' flags are standard package installation instructions.

content.user_title: Write MATLAB and Octave code for scientific computing
content.value_statement: Scientists and engineers often struggle with MATLAB syntax and best practices. This skill provides comprehensive reference documentation for matrix operations, visualization, and numerical analysis.
actual_capabilities: Generate MATLAB code for matrix operations and linear algebra
Create data visualization scripts with 2D and 3D plotting
Write Octave-compatible code for cross-platform use
Convert between MATLAB and Python code
Implement numerical simulations and differential equation solvers
Guide data import and export for CSV, Excel, and MAT files
limitations: Requires MATLAB or GNU Octave installed locally to execute scripts
MATLAB requires a commercial license for execution
Some MATLAB toolbox functions are not available in GNU Octave

use_cases.title: Implement numerical simulations
use_cases.description: Write MATLAB code for solving differential equations, signal processing, and statistical analysis in research workflows.

use_cases.title: Learn MATLAB programming basics
use_cases.description: Get help with MATLAB syntax, matrix operations, and plotting for coursework and engineering projects.

use_cases.title: Process and visualize data
use_cases.description: Create scripts to import CSV and Excel files, perform statistical analysis, and generate publication-quality figures.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Matrix Operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Write MATLAB code to create a 3x3 matrix, calculate its eigenvalues, and plot the results.

prompt_templates.title: Data Visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate MATLAB code to read data from a CSV file and create a multi-panel figure with line plots and bar charts.

prompt_templates.title: Solve Differential Equations
prompt_templates.prompt: Write MATLAB code to solve the damped harmonic oscillator equation and plot the displacement over time.

prompt_templates.title: Python Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to call NumPy and Pandas from MATLAB to process a dataset and return results to MATLAB variables.

output_examples.input: How do I create a 3D surface plot in MATLAB?
output: Use meshgrid to create X and Y coordinate grids
Calculate Z values from your function
Call surf(X, Y, Z) to render the surface
Add colorbar and labels for clarity

output_examples.input: What is the difference between MATLAB and Octave?
output: Octave is free and open-source while MATLAB requires a license
Octave allows # for comments while MATLAB only uses %
Most MATLAB scripts run in Octave with minimal changes
Some MATLAB toolbox functions are not available in Octave

best_practices: Vectorize operations instead of using loops for better performance
Preallocate arrays before loops to avoid memory reallocation
Use readtable for mixed data types and readmatrix for numeric-only data
anti_patterns: Do not grow arrays inside loops without preallocation
Avoid using inv(A)*b when A backslash b is more efficient and numerically stable
Do not use double quotes with escape sequences if you need Octave compatibility

faq.question: Can I run MATLAB scripts without a MATLAB license?
faq.answer: Yes, use GNU Octave which is free and open-source. Most MATLAB scripts run in Octave with minimal changes.

faq.question: How do I install GNU Octave?
faq.answer: On macOS use 'brew install octave', on Ubuntu use 'sudo apt install octave', or download from octave.org for Windows.

faq.question: Can MATLAB call Python code?
faq.answer: Yes, use the py. prefix to call Python functions directly from MATLAB, like py.numpy.array() or py.pandas.read_csv().

faq.question: What file formats can MATLAB read?
faq.answer: MATLAB reads CSV, Excel, text files, images, audio, MAT files, HDF5, and many scientific data formats.

faq.question: How do I make my code work in both MATLAB and Octave?
faq.answer: Use % for comments, single quotes for strings, avoid MATLAB-specific toolbox functions, and test in both environments.

faq.question: What is the best way to solve linear equations?
faq.answer: Use the backslash operator: x = A \ b. This is more efficient and numerically stable than inv(A) * b.
